1.title: Tacos and Teequila
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Leftover Takeover
2.plot: The competitors are called upon to rescue foods that would normally be thrown out in a special leftovers competition. Some unfinished Chinese takeout and something remaining from a meal at an Italian restaurant make for some fusion cooking in round one. Half of a sandwich and a bottle of sweet liquid are two of the leftover surprises in the second basket. Then the chefs face a confounding culinary puzzle when they find coffee and grapes in the dessert basket.

3.title: Luck of the Irish
3.plot: The chefs have the good fortune of getting treats from Ireland in every basket from an iconic stout and an Irish delicacy to a favorite Irish ice cream treat.

4.title: Beer and Brats
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Hush Puppy Love
5.plot: Hush puppies and black-eyed peas, y'all! Southern classics are in the first basket, while something fried and something sweet meet in basket two. And fruity, creamy, doughy desserts are the result of a busy final round.

6.title: Wild Game Plan
6.plot: The competitors are in for some wild times after they learn they'll be working with game meat in every round, starting with wild boar in the first basket. Two wild proteins then make for a crowded entrée basket. Finally, Black Forest cake is the sweetest of the woodsy treasures that the two remaining chefs are up against in the dessert round.

7.title: Sensational Sandwiches
7.plot: The chefs get revved up for a sensational sandwich battle that begins with a mound of meat and some colorful potatoes in round one. Everyone's favorite hybrid bird makes an appearance in the second basket. And sandwiches for dessert? You bet! The final two chefs take on a salty-and-sweet basket in the last round.

8.title: A Frog Leg Up
8.plot: Four chefs open the first basket to find a strange, modern food: donut-shaped sushi. Will they know how to make it work with a crunchy snack in their appetizers? The judges are happy to see frog legs in the second basket, but they aren't quick to leap to any conclusions about how the entrees will turn out. And some challenging textures in the dessert basket jeopardize the last two chefs' chances for perfect final plates.

9.title: Chicken Challenge
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Surf and Turf
10.plot: The chefs are asked to make a special-occasion meal, starting with appetizers that include a rare prized crustacean. In the entree basket, the competitors encounter more exquisite ingredients from land and sea -- as well as a sweet curveball. And the final two chefs open the dessert basket to find a playful take on the theme that proves to be quite difficult.

11.title: Rocky Mountain Masters
11.plot: Will the chefs know how to turn Rocky Mountain oysters into a tasty appetizer? A soda shop treat is a sweet hurdle for the entree-round competitors, and the finalists find a jackfruit in the Round Three dessert box.

13.title: Under the Cuban Sun
13.plot: Four chefs with personal connections to Cuba cook with a variety of Cuban foods. Butchering a whole fish gives one chef a lot of trouble in round one, and a jarred version of a favorite Cuban sauce appears in the entree basket.

0.title: Pilot
0.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Octopus, Duck, Animal Crackers
1.plot: Will the judges prefer the more whimsical or traditional dish?

2.title: Tofu, Blueberries and Oysters
2.plot: What will it take to amaze the judges all the way through to the dessert course when the ingredients include Tofu, Blueberries and Oysters.

3.title: Avocado, Tahini, Bran Flakes
3.plot: The chefs are baffled to find a breakfast staple in the Appetizer Round mystery basket. Who will "flake" out and who can make it work?

4.title: Banana, Collard Greens, Grits
4.plot: Wrapped in bacon, wrapped in basil, fried and bruleed, bananas take center stage in the appetizer round. But when one chef's creation falls apart, is there a sure fire banana backup plan?

5.title: Yucca, Watermelon, Tortillas
5.plot: It's grace under pressure as the chefs attempt to wow the judges. Can watermelon and pepper jack cheese make for a good pairing?

6.title: Canned Peaches, Rice Cakes, Beets
6.plot: Stymied by canned peaches in the appetizer round and fruit punch and rice cakes for the entree. The chefs struggle for a fresh approach. It all comes down to a heated dessert face-off combining beets, goat cheese and oatmeal.

7.title: Quail, Arctic Char, Beer
7.plot: The chefs are determined to give their all from the start. Between Quail, Arctic Char, and Beer which of the showoffs, risk-takers and storytellers make this competition a tense one, right down to the last "chop."

8.title: Coconut, Calamari and Donuts
8.plot: The mandatory ingredients in the appetizer basket evoke nervous laughter and general panic.

9.title: Mac & Cheese, Cola and Bacon
9.plot: When a box of macaroni and cheese appears in the appetizer basket, the contestants endeavor to find a place for fluorescent cheese powder in their gourmet dishes.

10.title: String Cheese, Jicama and Gingersnaps
10.plot: The judges are dismayed when some of the chefs fail to creatively transform the mystery ingredients in the appetizer course. But what can you do with string cheese?

11.title: Jumbo Shrimp, Pepperoncini, Cereal
11.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

12.title: Chocolate, Mussels and Figs
12.plot: Ted Allen hosts as the chefs open their appetizer baskets to find bitter-sweet chocolate, figs and mussels. The chefs know that three of them will face being chopped, while only one can claim sweet victory.

13.title: Strawberries, Turkey and Gummi Bears
13.plot: See which challenger gets chopped after each round with ingredients like Strawberries, Turkey and Gummy Bears.

1.title: A Prickly Situation
1.plot: See which contestant gets chopped after each round with ingredients like Sea Urchin, Brioche and Fennel.

2.title: Salty Veggies & Heated Battles
2.plot: An unusually salty vegetable presents the chefs with a quandary in the Appetizer Round. Then a red-hot battle ensues in the entree round

3.title: High Hopes
3.plot: The judges have high hopes for this group of up-and-coming chefs, but there is some sloppy work in the Appetizer Round when the contestants must work with whole calamari.

4.title: Floundering Around
4.plot: A challenging cut of meat in the mystery basket ups the level of difficulty in the Appetizer Round. For the entree course the chefs must devise big plans for some miniature produce and a whole flounder.

5.title: Pride on the Plate
5.plot: Pride is on the plate as the chefs seek to represent their cultural heritage through distinctive duck appetizers.

6.title: Pretty Please with a Pepper on Top
6.plot: For the appetizer course, the judges get an earful of philosophy and a mouthful of piquillo peppers.

7.title: Pods, Grills and Sticky Fingers
7.plot: See which contestant gets chopped after each round with ingredients like Jumbo Shrimp, edamame, and golden raisins.

8.title: A Wish Upon a Starfruit
8.plot: With liquor in the entree basket, the flames fly high, but when the adrenaline rush is over, it's the artful presentations that garner attention.

9.title: Buckwheat Blunders and Twists of Fate
9.plot: After unpacking a challenging Appetizer Basket, the chefs get creative using buckwheat flour to make crepes, crusts and fritters.

10.title: The Ultimate Face-Off
10.plot: Don't miss this ultimate face-off! In this first installment in a special four-part series, previous Chopped Champions return to compete again.

11.title: Best of the Best
11.plot: Gotta tune in to find out who has the chops to be the Chopped Champion again! In this second installment in a special series, four winners return to battle for superiority in the kitchen.

12.title: All Stars Showdown
12.plot: In this must-watch third installment in a special four-part series, the reigning Chopped Champion and three other previous winners return to compete.

13.title: Bring It!
13.plot: You won't believe what happens in the final competition in the all-stars series, when four Chopped Champions face off for a chance to reclaim the title and bank another $10,000.

1.title: When Chefs Collide
1.plot: The chefs must use kumquats and croissants in their appetizers; green beans and ground pork in their entrées; and grits in their desserts.

2.title: Oh My Goshy, Umeboshi!
2.plot: A slippery shocker in the appetizer basket starts things off on a terrifying note. Featured ingredients include umeboshi; parsnips and soda crackers.

3.title: Judge Knows Best
3.plot: Two chefs attempt to cook a fish that is traditionally used for sushi, the results, of course, are questionable.

4.title: A Nori Story
4.plot: A chef decides to take a familiar route with beef but is challenged by an unfamiliar mystery ingredient. Will it work?

5.title: Sticking to It
5.plot: Just how the graham cracker crumbles in the Appetizer Round depends on how the chefs can recover from setbacks. One contestant struggles to plate after suffering a cut. Then in the EntrÃ©e Round one chef breaks a plate.

6.title: Season's Choppings
6.plot: Tis the season to shake things up. The chefs learn that as an added challenge, their dishes must have a holiday theme. The mystery ingredients include venison and marshmallows.

7.title: Flower Power
7.plot: Contestants find ways to incorporate zucchini blossoms into their appetizers. The judges are disturbed by how one chef disrespects the kitchen in the Entree Round. In the Dessert Round fresh chickpeas are in the mystery basket.

8.title: Sweet Redemption
8.plot: In this must-watch, unprecedented event four previous runners-up return to see who can save face and finally become the Chopped Champion.

9.title: Winging It
9.plot: The chefs race to get chicken wings cooked in time. Then in the Entree Round, the chefs have caught a break with catfish in the basket. For the Dessert Round they work with cherry tomatoes.

10.title: In a Pinch
10.plot: When the chefs make some unusual choices in composing soft-shell crab appetizers, the judges give them a chance to defend their dishes or graciously accept criticism.

11.title: Raw Enthusiasm
11.plot: The stoves are underutilized as the chefs show their raw enthusiasm for oysters. The entrÃ©es have the judges debating who successfully incorporated a funky-flavored fruit.

12.title: Against the Tide
12.plot: The chefs find themselves swimming against the tide when they have to combine fish with chocolate in the Appetizer Round. Then for the entrÃ©e course, the remaining contestants pull from their cultural backgrounds.

13.title: Chopped Liver
13.plot: Calves' livers and ranch dressing begin the battle between the chefs.

1.title: Rattle & Roll
1.plot: Rattlesnake meat must be included in the chefs first course.

2.title: My Froggy Clementine
2.plot: The chefs find frog legs in the first basket for the Appetizer Round.

3.title: Jitters & Giant Eggs
3.plot: Panic threatens to paralyze one of the competitors who is feeling jittery.

4.title: Dr. Deckle & Mr. Fried
4.plot: Three of the four chefs make a huge mistake with the jumbo shrimp.

5.title: Mussels Mastery & Cotton Candy Can-Do
5.plot: The chefs have to come up with tasty mussel appetizers in just 20 minutes.

6.title: First Things Worst
6.plot: It's up to the judges to determine which chef fell short.

7.title: Fired Up!
7.plot: The competitors discover this competition is a grilling challenge.

8.title: Quahog Quandaries and Pickle Puzzles
8.plot: The two remaining chefs take the intensity level in the kitchen up a notch.

9.title: Turbot Powered
9.plot: A super bitter ingredient leaves the chefs in a quandary.

10.title: Keep on Cook'n On
10.plot: One of the finalists suffers an injury as he attempts a Chopped first.

11.title: Green Apps and Lamb
11.plot: Mint liqueur and canned fish make an odd combination for the first course.

12.title: Crunch Time
12.plot: The appetizer basket's ingredients get the chefs pondering ballgame fare.

13.title: Rowdy with a Chance of Meatballs
13.plot: In the final, the two remaining chefs go all out.

1.title: Dream'n of Redeem'n
1.plot: Four previously defeated competitors return to the Chopped kitchen.

2.title: Wok This Way
2.plot: One of the competitors breaks out the wok.

3.title: Squashed
3.plot: Four talented women set out to claim the title of Chopped Champion.

4.title: $50,000 Tournament: Part 1
4.plot: Four previous winners return to compete in a five-part Chopped event.

5.title: $50,000 Tournament: Part 2
5.plot: The chefs set off with record speed and exceptional confidence in part 2.

6.title: $50,000 Tournament: Part 3
6.plot: The competitors find chicken in the entree basket, along with a surprise!

7.title: $50,000 Tournament: Part 4
7.plot: Who will secure the very last place in the Grand Finale champions' contest?

8.title: $50,000 Tournament: Grand Finale
8.plot: Who is the unstoppable, un-"choppable" champion?

9.title: Spouting Off
9.plot: One competitor's sudsy spout of brew splashes over his cooking area.

10.title: When Octopuses Attack!
10.plot: The chefs are given 20 minutes to cook everyone's favorite cephalopod.

11.title: Fright Bites
11.plot: Treats fill the mystery baskets and the trick is on the brave competitors.

12.title: Cornuchopia
12.plot: The chefs are asked to create a meal with Thanksgiving in mind.

13.title: Yes, Virginia, There Is a Chopping Block
13.plot: In honor of the holidays, the chefs are asked to keep with a seasonal theme. The holiday dishes are made using non-traditional ingredients, such as gingerbread oysters and a sweet jarred fruit.

1.title: Victory on the Brain
1.plot: Chefs must figure out what to do with goat brains in the appetizer round.

2.title: Prove It on the Plate
2.plot: The appetizer round ends with a last-minute dash to get it on the plate.

3.title: Marrowly We Roll Along
3.plot: Will the chefs know what to do to marry marrow bones with the other items?

4.title: Doughs and Don'ts
4.plot: In preparing her trout appetizer, a feisty chef faces a big set back.

5.title: A Cornish Mess
5.plot: The chefs struggle to create perfect Peking duck appetizers.

6.title: Step Right Up!
6.plot: Which chef will deliver the better dessert from a basket with Latin flair?

7.title: All-Stars Tournament: Part 1
7.plot: Sixteen celebrity chefs compete in an exclusive five-part Chopped event.

8.title: All-Stars Tournament: Part 2
8.plot: Part 2 of 5. Four popular Food Network personalities compete for a chance to win $50,000 for their charity. They must use teething biscuits in their appetizers; a kid's breakfast favorite in their entrees; and jelly beans and baby fennel in their desserts.

9.title: All-Stars Tournament: Part 3
9.plot: Part 3 or 5. Four acclaimed chefs compete for charity. They must use fresh pasta sheets in their appetizers; big fish and little crackers in their entrees; and a Chinese spice in their desserts.

10.title: All-Stars Tournament: Part 4
10.plot: The tables have turned! Chopped judges become Chopped competitors.

11.title: All-Stars Tournament: Grand Finale!
11.plot: The four celebrity chefs finally face off for their favorite charities.

12.title: Chefs on a Mission
12.plot: Four competitors from rival cities passionately jump into the first round.

1.title: The Icing on the Steak
1.plot: In the first round, our four chefs try to get a leg up on the competition.

2.title: Canned Cheese, Please!
2.plot: The chefs are not all smiles when they see the first-round basket.

3.title: Saying Sayonara
3.plot: Ah, shucks! Oysters in the first basket cause some problems.

4.title: Have a Heart
4.plot: Chefs wrestle with a heart-stopping protein in the entree round.

5.title: Gotta Grill!
5.plot: It is a Chopping Block block party!

6.title: Get It Together!
6.plot: The chefs have to get it together fast, to get a cohesive dish made.

7.title: Bite Your Pickled Beef Tongue
7.plot: With tongue in the 1st basket, the chefs attempt to lick their competition.

8.title: Go for It!
8.plot: The competitors are given tequila to give their entree dishes a kick.

9.title: Thyme Flies
9.plot: The chefs must use two proteins in their appetizers; hen-of-the woods mushrooms in their entrees; and cookie dough in their desserts.

10.title: Nopales, No Problem
10.plot: The chefs must stay sharp - the first basket includes prickly nopales.

1.title: Easy Peasy?
1.plot: Four English chefs face off to see who will be headed back with big money.

2.title: Ladies First!
2.plot: Four women compete for the $10,000 prize.

3.title: Sweet Second Chance!
3.plot: Four previously-defeated chefs get a second chance at the $10,000 prize!

4.title: Chard & True
4.plot: Octo-tastic! The four chefs take on an eight-armed mystery ingredient.

5.title: My Way
5.plot: The judges wonder how the chefs' unique experiences will come into play. Two seafood ingredients are paired with a pretty fruit in the appetizer round. Later, borscht soup stumps the chefs in the dessert round.

6.title: A Is for Apple, U Is for Udon
6.plot: The chefs find some beautiful ingredients in the first basket.

1.title: Champions' Tournament: Part 1
1.plot: Four Chopped heroes return to action to see who can win again.

2.title: Champions' Tournament: Part 2
2.plot: Four returning winners fight for a spot in the $50,000 grand finale.

3.title: Champions' Tournament: Part 3
3.plot: Only two spots remain in the Grand Finale competition. Who will win them?

4.title: Champions' Tournament: Part 4
4.plot: Former winners fight for the last remaining spot in the Grand Finale.

5.title: Champions' Tournament: Grand Finale
5.plot: Only one two-time champ can become a "three-peater" and claim the prize.

6.title: Time & Space
6.plot: Chefs find a shocker of a protein in the basket.

7.title: Everything's Rosy
7.plot: Things take a rosy turn in the entree round, with edible flowers.

8.title: Trick or Treat, Chicken Feet!
8.plot: It's Halloween! The chefs are working with candy and ... chicken feet!

9.title: Make a Splash!
9.plot: It's a gingerbread dough showdown in the dessert round!

10.title: One in a Hundred
10.plot: The first round has the competitors combining a sweet bread and a melon.

11.title: Blood Orange Sorbet, Sweat & Tears
11.plot: The chefs hope that their sausage appetizer will awaken the judges' senses.

12.title: Give It Your All
12.plot: It's Thanksgiving and four chefs are giving it all they have. They are cooking with some traditional Turkey Day favorites.

13.title: Class Acts
13.plot: Class is in session in the Chopped kitchen!

14.title: Yakety Yak, Yak, Yak
14.plot: The competitors have to design a main course with yak and dried shrimp.

15.title: Can't Catch Me, I'm the Gingerbread Lobster!
15.plot: A holiday challenge finds the chefs using gingerbread in their appetizers; a prized piece of meat in their entrées; and an often-disparaged seasonal classic in their desserts.

16.title: Duck for Dinner
16.plot: The judges are pleased to see duck confit in the first basket.

1.title: The Big Scoop
1.plot: What a surprise when the big scoop in dessert is vanilla ice cream!

2.title: Chop on Through
2.plot: The chefs find a fruit and a root in the appetizer basket. In the entrée round, they must cook a cut of meat with a peculiar name. And, Camembert cheese shows up in the dessert round.

3.title: Far Far Out!
3.plot: Chefs combine far far, an Indian snack food, with squab - who will succeed?

4.title: Frozen Fries with That?
4.plot: Can the chefs impress the judges after finding a still-frozen ingredient?

5.title: Redemption Competition
5.plot: Four previous runners-up compete to see which one walks away the winner.

6.title: On the Line
6.plot: Competitors bring their international know-how to the Chopped kitchen.

1.title: I'm Your Huckleberry
1.plot: The chefs must incorporate octopus and huckleberry into their appetizers; champagne into their entrees; and a Mexican cheese into their desserts.

2.title: Chewing the Caul Fat
2.plot: In the entree round the chefs take on Savoy cabbage & a curious web of fat.

3.title: Good Chop, Bad Chop?
3.plot: What will the judges think of an unorthodox decision with the avocados? The chefs must use canned ham in their appetizers; perch in their entrées; and croissants in their desserts.

4.title: Leftovers Extravaganza!
4.plot: In this competition, every basket contains some 'leftover' ingredients. Leftovers are transformed into gourmet appetizers, entrées and desserts. Featured ingredients include leftover pizza, Chinese food and cold refried beans.

5.title: Plenty of Fish
5.plot: The chefs do their best to delicately cook a familiar fish. For appetizers, tiny Indian gourds; for entrées, smelly fish product and lutefisk; for desserts, Chinese sausage.

6.title: Sound the Alarm!
6.plot: Four firefighters face off in the kitchen. They must use hot dogs and smoked mozzarella in their appetizers; bison steaks and fire-roasted tomatoes in their entrées; and crescent-roll dough in their desserts.

7.title: Viewers' Choice!
7.plot: Chopped viewers get to weigh in on the ingredients in the mystery basket.

8.title: All Stars: Iron Chefs Do Battle
8.plot: Part 1 of 5. Four world-class Iron Chefs go, head-to-head, competing for charity. They must use beef tendon and crawfish in their appetizers; a challenging protein in their entrées; and black beans in their desserts.

9.title: Ready, Set, Escargot!
9.plot: The chefs must use escargots and red jalapeños in their appetizers; Chinese eggplants and ground lamb in their entrées; and roasted noodles in their desserts.

10.title: All Stars: Prime Time vs. Day Time
10.plot: Part 2 of 5. Globe-trotting gourmets. Four sensational series' hosts bring international flavors to the All-Stars tournament. Can these All-Stars hit their stride?

11.title: Own It!
11.plot: Four chef/entrepreneurs have something to prove in the Chopped kitchen. The chefs must use hearts of palm and rabbit escabeche in their appetizer; goat chops in their entrées; and blue-corn tortilla chips in their desserts.

12.title: All Stars: Food Network Star Contestants
12.plot: Part 3 of 5. Four "Food Network Star" alums compete in the All-Stars Tournament for charity. Mystery ingredients include razor clams; white apricots; and bacon. Appearing: Justin Balmes; Penny Davidi; Vic "Vegas" Moea; Chris Nirschel.

13.title: All Stars: Judge Remix
13.plot: Part 4 of 5. "Chopped" judges Alex Guarnaschelli, Marc Murphy, Marcus Samuelsson and Chris Santos compete in the All-Stars Tournament for charity. Amanda Freitag, Aaron Sanchez and Geoffrey Zakarian judge their dishes.

14.title: Yuzu Never Know
14.plot: Does yuzu juice go with sturgeon? That's part of the first-round riddle.

15.title: All Stars: Grand Finale
15.plot: The final round of the All-Stars Tournament finds four celebrity chefs preparing beef heart, panforte and pancetta while competing to win $50,000 for their favorite charity.

16.title: Reversal of Fortune
16.plot: The chefs must use green-goddess salad dressing in their appetizers; fortune cookies and branzino in their entrées; and sourdough bread in their desserts.

1.title: Grilltastic!
1.plot: A grilling challenge. The chefs get an unusual wake-up call in a basket: gummy fried eggs, Wagu beef, marshmallow spread and stout beer.

2.title: Sunny Side Apps
2.plot: The chefs get an unusual wake-up call in the appetizer basket: gummy fried eggs. Will they be able to successfully transform this novelty candy into something that tastes good with corned beef?

3.title: A Guts Reaction
3.plot: The chefs need to have guts when opening the first basket.

4.title: Chocolate Challenge
4.plot: It's a chocolate lover's dream competition: Chocolate in every course!

5.title: Pride of New Orleans
5.plot: Four chefs from the Big Easy take on the challenge of the Chopped Kitchen. Chai tea is among the mystery ingredients.

6.title: All-American Competition
6.plot: Fierce competition is a matter of national and personal pride.

7.title: Orzo It Seemed
7.plot: The chefs must integrate tiny pasta & a powerful liqueur into their dishes.

8.title: Food Network Stars!
8.plot: Winners of the hit series Food Network Star compete to see who can beam brightest in the Chopped Kitchen!

9.title: Grill Masters: Part One
9.plot: Part 1 of 5. Four grill masters tackle ingredients ranging from cookies to yak steaks.

10.title: Grill Masters: Part Two
10.plot: Part 2 of 5. Four more master grillers vie for a spot in the finale. They must use Hawaiian blue prawns in their appetizers; boar in their entrées; and Hatch chile taffy, an Italian ingredient, in their desserts.

11.title: Belly Dance!
11.plot: The chefs' expertise with tuna belly comes into play in the first round.

12.title: Grill Masters: Part Three
12.plot: Part 3 of 5. Grill masters must use creamed spinach and oysters in their appetizers; a topical fruit in their entrées; and marshmallows in their desserts. The winner advances to the $50,000 finale.

13.title: Cake Walk
13.plot: Carrot cake and caramel corn are among the mystery ingredients.

14.title: Grill Masters: Part Four
14.plot: Part 4 of 5. Four more pit masters face off for the final spot in the $50,000 finale. Featured ingredients include speculoos, pork butt and fruit leather.

15.title: Oui, Oui, Confit
15.plot: The judges are pleased to see duck confit in the first basket.

16.title: Grill Masters: Finale
16.plot: Conclusion. The four finalists face off for $50,000 in the final round of the Grill Masters battle. Sardines, canned sloppy-joe filling and steak are among the mystery ingredients.

17.title: Drawing a Flank
17.plot: The competitors must match espresso powder with flank steak.

1.title: Stacking Up
1.plot: With frozen pancakes in the final basket, whose dessert will stack up?

2.title: A Bunny Thing Happened
2.plot: In the entree round, the chefs have to hop to it with a chocolate bunny.

3.title: Class Acts, Too
3.plot: Class is once again in session in the Chopped Kitchen.

4.title: No Kidding!
4.plot: Four talented teen cooks take over the kitchen. They are challenged to use fish fillets and a sugary frozen treat in their appetizers; cotton candy and fried onions in their entrées; and popcorn in their desserts.

5.title: Charge!
5.plot: With pluck aplenty, four chefs charge into the competition.

6.title: A Very Piggy Halloween
6.plot: A Halloween-themed battle is full of tricks and treats as the competing chefs find pig snouts in their baskets in the appetizer round, popping candy and a spicy ingredient in the entrée round, lollipops and cereal bars in the dessert round.

7.title: Pigging Out
7.plot: The surprise for the competitors in the first basket, a whole pig's head. The second basket contains a nose-to-tail theme.

8.title: Unsung Heroes
8.plot: The four competing chefs are do-gooders in their communities. Which chef's final dish will complete the winning meal?

9.title: Happy Turkey Gizzards Day!
9.plot: A Thanksgiving battle features turkey gizzards in the appetizer round; pumpkin pie as an entrée ingredient; and desserts made with chocolate.

10.title: For Sake's Sake
10.plot: The chefs must work hard to make terrific entrees with sable fish and sake.

11.title: Chopping in a Winter Wonderland
11.plot: The holiday season is celebrated throughout the competition, beginning with an appetizer round that includes spiral ham and Italian cookies. Later, entrées are created using Santa Claus melons; and desserts are made with eggnog and Hanukkan gelt.

12.title: Bird in the Pan
12.plot: In the entree round, chefs attempt to make delicious Cornish hen dishes.

13.title: Thirsty for Victory
13.plot: Lump crab-meat and ice-cream cones are the featured ingredients in the appetizer round. Later, the entrée round requires the use of a sports drink. Finally, for dessert, the remaining chefs are given carob syrup and spaghetti squash.

14.title: Trout Bout
14.plot: With brook trout in the first basket, the chefs try to reel the judges in.

15.title: Belly Up
15.plot: One competing chef attempts to recover, after accidentally dropping the entrée ingredient of pork belly onto the floor.

1.title: Leftovers Overload
1.plot: All the baskets are full of leftover foods. So, the competitors use some tricks. The judges are served a soup made out of a sub sandwich; and entrées are prepared using rib-eye steak.

2.title: Chopped Champions: Part 1
2.plot: Part 1 of 5. The fourth champions tournament begins, when four previous winners return and compete for a chance at a $50,000 grand prize. Mystery-basket ingredients include haggis, sweet dough and unripe plantains.

3.title: Chopped Champions: Part 2
3.plot: Part 2 of 5. The fourth champions tournament continues with four returning chefs having to create appetizers that combine a seafood delicacy with a traditional holiday food. Later, entrees are prepared using peanut butter, jelly and squab.

4.title: Chopped Champions: Part 3
4.plot: Part 3 of 5. Four past winners return and compete for a chance at a $50,000 grand prize. They must use eel in their appetizers; frog legs and gin in their entrees; and Araucana eggs and coconut macaroons in their desserts.

5.title: Chopped Champions: Part 4
5.plot: Part 4 of 5. The fourth champions tournament continues with four returning chefs competing for the single place remaining. The have to create appetizers out of a sour-apple-martini mix. Later, entrees are prepared using a sweet wine.

6.title: Hecho En the Chopped Kitchen
6.plot: The chefs find exciting ingredients from Mexico featured throughout the competition, including pigs feet and tres leches cake in the appetizer basket; goat chops in the entrée basket; and yucca and coconuts for dessert.

7.title: Chopped Champions: Finale
7.plot: Conclusion. The final round of Chopped Champions finds the four finalists competing for the $50,000 grand prize. Sea snails, carrot juice and honeycomb are among the mystery ingredients.

8.title: Make No Mistake
8.plot: Chefs who made big mistakes in their first competition return to try again.

9.title: Untrained, Undaunted
9.plot: Four amateur cooks believe they can show the pros how it's done. They work with sushi in the appetizer round; and, for entrées, they must use ostrich fillets and blueberry wine.

10.title: Just for the Halibut
10.plot: The competing chefs must create appetizers, using smoked beef tongue and garbanzo beans; and in the entrée round, they cook with halibut and aquavit. For dessert, banana chips and almond butter are the featured ingredients.

11.title: Redemption Intention
11.plot: Four former runners-up return to compete. In the appetizer round, they are given a precooked protein and a slimy sea creature as ingredients; and for entrées, they must use poultry tongue and pineapple.

1.title: Heads Up!
1.plot: The chefs are alarmed to see an ingredient in the appetizer basket staring back at them. Later, a dangerous situation arises while entrées are being prepared; and desserts are made using yellow rice and persimmons.

2.title: Chopped All-Stars: Food Network vs. Cooking Channel
2.plot: Part 1 of 5. An "All-Stars" tournament begins with personalities from the Food Network and the Cooking Channel going head-to-head for their charities, when they encounter something fishy during the entrée round. Later, desserts are made using marshmallows.

3.title: Viewers' Choice Baskets
3.plot: Chopped fans choose the ingredients for this Viewers' Choice competition.

4.title: Chopped All-Stars: Mega Chefs
4.plot: Part 2 of 5. An "All-Stars" tournament continues with chefs Elizabeth Falkner, Chuck Hughes, Gavin Kaysen and Richard Blais taking on mystery baskets that include sea bass and cream soda in the appetizer round, followed by oxtail and labneh for entrÃ©es.

5.title: Aussie Awesome
5.plot: The chefs open the first basket to find ingredients inspired by Australia.

6.title: Chopped All-Stars: Judges
6.plot: Part 3 of 5. An "All-Stars" tournament continues with four Chopped (2007) judges (Scott Conant, Amanda Freitag, Alex Guarnaschelli and Marc Murphy) putting their cooking skills to the test, during an appetizing round that features diver scallops. Also: canned pizza sauce must be used in entrees.

7.title: Chopped All-Stars: Celebrities
7.plot: Part 4 of 5. An "All-Stars" tournament continues with celebrities Judy Gold, Joey Fatone, Laila Ali and Johnny Weir competing. First, they are given vanilla cupcakes to transform into appetizers; and later, make entrees with ingredients that are crispy and jiggly. The final desserts round involves curry powder and peanut shaped candy.

8.title: Without Missing a Beet
8.plot: A pre-grilled protein and a dried fruit must be used in appetizers; a chef deals with jitters during the entrée round; and curry desserts are presented to the judges before a winner is declared.

9.title: Chopped All-Stars: Finale!
9.plot: Conclusion. An "All-Stars" tournament ends with a chef winning $50,000 for their charity. But first, the appetizer round features a salty vegetable and fresh seafood. Also: entrees are prepared using cheddar-filled pretzels; and desserts are made with freeze-dried grapes and Marcona almonds. Judges: Aarón Sánchez, Geoffrey Zakarian and Marcus Samuelsson.

10.title: Momumental
10.plot: Talented moms, who aren't professional chefs, take on the Chopped Kitchen.

11.title: Amazing Amateurs
11.plot: Four amateur chefs are tasked with using a sea creature in appetizers and are thrown for a loop by an unfamiliar tuber in the entrée round. Also: desserts must include crackers and red wine.

12.title: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner!
12.plot: Black Forest bacon and prune juice are the first ingredients given to the chefs, tasked with the challenge of preparing dishes that represent breakfast, lunch and dinner in the Chopped Kitchen.

13.title: Military Salute
13.plot: Hup, two, three - four chefs who have served in the Army or Navy compete. Included: the appetizer-course basket contains a freeze-dried surprise; and entrée ingredients consist of a large loaf, a chop of meat and a tough candy.

14.title: Cook Your Butt Off!
14.plot: Four chefs with incredible weight-loss stories compete. They try to prepare healthy dishes for the judges, which proves challenging in the appetizer round, when they are faced with a fatty protein. Also: they must break down a fish.

15.title: Fry, Fry Again
15.plot: The chefs are given pots of bubbling oil to create crispy, delish dishes. A deep-fried food must appear on each plate throughout the competition, beginning in the appetizer round when catfish is the main ingredient.

16.title: Better Saffron Than Sorry
16.plot: A new season of Chopped All-Stars begins April 7 at 9/8c on Food Network.

17.title: Take Heart
17.plot: In the first round, the chefs discover various creative ways to combine peppers and pork. The judges wonder why one chef makes a strange, last-minute decision. Then in the entree round, they wrestle with a heart-stopping protein.

1.title: Cleaver Fever
1.plot: To avoid cleaver fever, the competitors have to work with bacon popcorn, which is in the first basket; the basket in the entrée round contains lamb; the basket in the final round contains a mashed treat and a floral syrup.

2.title: Mix and Mache
2.plot: The first basket's mix of ingredients includes mache and pickled sausage.

3.title: Wheatgrass Roots
3.plot: An odd mix of ingredients in the first basket, including mache and pickled sausage, has the chefs working hard to complete unique appetizers. Then in the entree round, the chefs must make squid dishes that impress the judges.

4.title: Gyro We Go Again
4.plot: Competition begins with gyro meat in the appetizer round, which features hearts of palm as an ingredient. For entrées, the chefs must work with steak & donuts; and desserts are made from a classic American finger food and something sticky.

5.title: Big Fish, Small Basket
5.plot: The competitors leap into action and take on seitan and mescal for the appetizer round. Later, they find a pre-made sauce and a large fish in their entrée baskets; and for desserts, they must combine a pastry with a pork product.

6.title: Teen Invasion
6.plot: Teen chefs compete, preparing tuna and cereal in the appetizer round. Later, butchery is required in order to complete entrées; and dessert ingredients include a snack food and an Asian condiment.

7.title: Mochi Obliged
7.plot: Dishes, composed of escargot and biscuit dough, are served as appetizers; for entrées, the chefs work with an unfamiliar produce and an unappealing pate; and desserts are created using mochi and mango.

8.title: Sweet Surprises
8.plot: Something sweet is included in each of the baskets, beginning with a towering cake in the appetizer round. Later, the chefs need to incorporate a colorful dessert in their entrées and use a chocolaty treat when making their final dishes.

9.title: Wurst Case Scenario
9.plot: Energetic chefs hit the ground running with a currywurst dish.

10.title: Break a Crab Leg
10.plot: Ingredients that are difficult to identify are found in the appetizer basket. For entrées, the chefs must tackle a seafood surprise; and the two chef finalists must waste no time inventing desserts using jicama.

11.title: Walk on the Whelk Side
11.plot: Whelk snails and lemon bars are found in the appetizer baskets. For entrées, the chefs each show their personalities in lamb shawarma dishes; and the dessert round proves challenging with cucumber salad as the featured ingredient.

12.title: Chopped Family Feud
12.plot: Two sets of chef brothers battle it out in the first Chopped family feud. Ingredients include falooda noodles in the appetizer round; steak and cinnamon rolls for entrées; and desserts made from a Greek pudding and Japanese candy.

1.title: Wasted!
1.plot: Food scraps are used in each round, beginning with herb stems and the remnants of a filleted fish for appetizer recipes. For entries, the chefs must work with potatoes that have eyes; and desserts are made with discarded oranges and bread.

2.title: Keep on Trucking
2.plot: Chefs, who operate food trucks, compete. First, they are forced to use flavored meats in their appetizer dishes; and later, they must use a sugary powder and a leafy vegetable in their entrées; and guanabana-flavored ice cream for dessert.

3.title: Sports Stars
3.plot: Sports stars Danica Patrick, Tiki Barber, Chuck Zito and Natalie Coughlin compete for charity. Included: appetizers are made using salmon; chocolate-covered marshmallows cause stress when preparing entrées; and olive-oil cakes must be transformed.

4.title: Hero Chefs
4.plot: Four extraordinary chefs, who serve their communities with their talents, compete. In the appetizer round, they are given chicken soup and barbecue sauce; and for entrees, they must combine scallops with two unusual produce items.

5.title: We Love Leftovers!
5.plot: There's nothing but leftovers for the chefs in all three rounds. First, they are tasked with transforming the remains of a casserole and uneaten takeout food. In the entrée round, the ingredients are something soggy and something sweet.

6.title: Count Your Chickens
6.plot: It's chicken, chicken and more chicken in the baskets for these chefs.

7.title: Liver and Learn
7.plot: The chefs receive calves' livers and ranch dressing in the first round. Then in the entree round, a small bird and a citrusy spice make for an interesting combination. And will hot sauce be a hit in the finalists' desserts?

8.title: Extreme Halloween
8.plot: Baskets with a Halloween theme challenge the chefs, who must make appetizers out of a bloody protein and a can of chips. Later, entrées are prepared with something gooey, gory and offal; the dessert round proves to be devilishly difficult.

9.title: Brunch Boxes
9.plot: The baskets are packed with ingredients from a brunch menu. In a champagne and caviar appetizer round, one chef makes a generous choice. Chefs pair seafood with pancake mix in the entree round.

10.title: Circus Spectacular
10.plot: Every basket in this competition features circus-themed ingredients, beginning with cotton candy and corn dogs in the appetizer round. Later, one chef creates his entrée by putting nachos and cheese in the food processor.

11.title: Competition Italiano
11.plot: The appetizer round brings Italian ingredients, including pasta dough, but time issues lead to some big problems. The tasty trend continues with veal chops and botargo in the basket. Then, desserts made with figs are the final two dishes.

12.title: Redeemed or Re-Chopped?
12.plot: With the odds stacked against them, four former runners-up seek redemption in the Chopped Kitchen. In the first round, a faux meat and a hot mustard must be successfully combined.

13.title: A Chopped Thanksgiving
13.plot: A battle, with a Thanksgiving twist, begins with the chefs working to elevate the traditional green-bean casserole in the appetizer round. Later, entrée ingredients include a big bird and a frozen orange treat.

14.title: Cloche Call
14.plot: In the appetizer round, the chefs must combine kimchi and gefilte fish; for entrées, the chefs work with uniquely flavored vodka and a green snack; for desserts, the chefs are given marshmallow cake and a citrusy water.

1.title: No Pain, No Shame
1.plot: The chefs get a special tool in the basket to help bust open a challenging ingredient: a giant jawbreaker. Then, a trendy pastry meets a North African stew in the second basket. Rosemary and ginger must be combined into a dessert.

2.title: Celebrity Holiday Bash
2.plot: The Chopped all-star party begins with sparkling cider and doughnuts in the first basket. Wagyu steaks are served up for the entree round. And the final round competitors rush to get their plum pudding desserts plated.

3.title: Teen Talent
3.plot: With a $40,000 scholarship on the line, four teen competitors' first basket contains a sweet drink and juicy fruit. Then, entrées are made using super sophisticated ingredients; and breakfast-like foods are transformed in the dessert round.

4.title: Tapas Time
4.plot: Chefs are challenged to create tapas for all 3 rounds. They begin w/Spanish ingredients in the appetizer round. Later, 1 chef deals w/a fire during the entrée round; and mini desserts are made w/Catalan cream before a winner is determined.

5.title: Waste Not
5.plot: Chefs make use of ingredients that are usually thrown out. Appetizers are made with juicer pulp and tea bags; salad dressing and remnants of poultry for entrées; desserts are made with veggie peels and discarded portions of fruit.

6.title: Firefighter Chefs
6.plot: Firefighters compete and get the meal started with some hearty meat-and-cheese appetizers. Will the judges enjoy them? Then in the entree round, some big errors with a non-basket-ingredient gets one of the judges upset.

7.title: Hoofin' It!
7.plot: When the clock starts ticking down, the chefs must rush to make appetizers with pickled pigs' feet and sweet potato chips. And one chef doesn't realize they've made a potentially costly mistake until it's too late.

8.title: Pizza Perfect
8.plot: In the first round, one of the competitors takes a loose interpretation of the theme. Then some unusual toppings must be on the entree pizzas. And, a pizza for dessert with candied mushrooms and salted caramel sauce.

9.title: Ambitious Amateurs
9.plot: Home cooks compete, preparing chicken tenderloins in the appetizer round. Later, one hopeful tries to impress the judges with an ambitious hanger steak dish; and the dessert basket features two very unusual ingredients.

10.title: All-Burger Meal!
10.plot: Chefs learn that they will be making hamburgers for every round, starting with veal burgers for appetizers. Then in the entree round a little quail egg causes a big headache. And who's ever heard of a dessert burger?

11.title: Chocolate Competition
11.plot: With chocolate in the baskets, the chefs must make this perennial favorite work in the first two savory courses. Then the remaining two competitors must combine two chocolate ingredients with cherries and German layer cake.

12.title: Bacon Baskets!
12.plot: Bacon appears in the basket in every round. Other ingredients include apple chips, dried cherries and French toast. Judges: Scott Conant, Amanda Freitag and Adam Sobel.

13.title: Beer Here!
13.plot: Chefs are brewing up as all three rounds are devoted to beer. Chefs must make sausages work with toasted lager for appetizers and a tasty tripel ale's in the basket for the entree round. The iconic beer & pretzels must be made into dessert.

1.title: Return and Redeem
1.plot: Four chefs who lost in previous competitions return, trying to win more than ever. A bright green dessert and a seafood snack must be worked into appetizers and quinoa and sour candy into entrees.

2.title: Grandma vs. Grandma
2.plot: For the first time ever four grandmothers do battle to make the most comforting and delicious course using new and "old school" ingredients such as bacon grease, meatloaf mix and oatmeal.

3.title: Chopped Tournament of Stars: Sports Stars!
3.plot: Brandi Chastain, Jackie Joyner-Kersee, Greg Louganis and Charles Oakley bring their fierceness and passion to the premiere competition of the Chopped $50,000 Celebrity Tournament.

4.title: Chopped Tournament of Stars: Rachael vs. Guy!
4.plot: The four competitors part two of the Celebrity Tournament are alums of Food Network's Rachael vs, Guy: Celebrity Cook-Off. But Coolio, Lou Diamond Phillips, Penn Jillette and Carnie Wilson try their hands in the Chopped Kitchen.

5.title: Dread and Breakfast
5.plot: Breakfast, lunch and dinner are made by the competing chefs, who must prepare a morning meal from coffee cake and cream-filled chocolate eggs. Round 2 features fish dishes and an emergency situation.

6.title: Chopped Tournament of Stars: Comedians!
6.plot: Bringing the funny to the Chopped Kitchen, Sinbad, Tommy Davidson, Robert Wuhl and Gillian Vigman compete for a chance to move on to the $50,000 finale. The stars open up the first basket and get a pork delicacy and a gummy candy.

7.title: Chopped Tournament of Stars: Actors!
7.plot: With only one spot left in the Chopped Celebrity Championship charity tournament finale, Lucas Grabeel, Michael Imperioli, Peter Scolari and Tasha Smith take on the role of chef.

8.title: Chopped Tournament of Stars: Finale!
8.plot: Conclusion. A "Tournament of Stars" winner is determined. But first, the finalists must transform a drive-thru snack and cold dessert into appetizers; prepare duck entrées; and create something tasty out of churros and champagne.

9.title: Burn for the Worse
9.plot: Two starchy ingredients, Chinese dumplings and Middle Eastern noodles, are used in the appetizer round. Later, one chef burns two of the mystery ingredients when making a lamb entrée; and pawpaw desserts are made before the winner is named.

10.title: Peri Peri Determined
10.plot: The fryer gets a lot of use, when the chefs are given chicken wings and African peri-peri rub to work with in the appetizer round. For entrees, a difficult cut of meat and a salty sandwich spread are mandatory ingredients; and pie dough shows up in the dessert basket.

11.title: Leftovers Rescue Mission
11.plot: All of the baskets contain leftovers. Included: the chefs must transform the contents of restaurant-takeout containers; use packets of hot sauce in their entrées; and make bacon-centric desserts.

12.title: Mother's Day
12.plot: Four mothers attempt to stay composed as they cook in a much larger arena. In the appetizer basket are chicken noodle soup and salsa. In the entree round, they must contend with a sugary ingredient often banned from breakfast.

13.title: An Egg Up
13.plot: The competing chefs are forced to cook with the so-called "100-year-old egg" in the appetizer round; find mango pudding in their entrée baskets; and make desserts with waffle cones.

14.title: G'day, Chefs!
14.plot: Basket contents have an Australian theme, beginning with lamb ribs and a very alcoholic beverage in Round 1. Also: the chefs serve emu entrées to the judges; and one finalist makes a mistake when using the ice-cream machine for dessert.

15.title: Cool, Palm and Perfected
15.plot: Appetizers are made using blowfish tail; the chefs have a can of something orange and a jar of date palm to work with when creating entrées; and basil juice is a key ingredient in the dessert round.

16.title: There Will Be Bloody Marys
16.plot: A fancy cake & a Bloody Mary are the first ingredients encountered by the competing chefs. Later, they are given ground chicken & seafood paella for entrées; & one of the finalists tries to recover from a screwup with the ice cream machine.

17.title: Four Fathers
17.plot: Four dads take on the Chopped Kitchen, but how will the fathers-turned-competitors fare w/fish & salt-vinegar potato chips in the appetizer round? A bottle of scotch is in the entrée basket; dessert ingredients are rice pudding & pretzels.

1.title: Salt Pearls of Wisdom
1.plot: Appetizers are made with shrimp and chickpeas; entrée ingredients include baklava and salt pearls; and dessert dishes feature booze and cashews.

2.title: Swai Not?
2.plot: Falafel mix and date paste are among the mandatory ingredients in the appetizer round. Also: a fish proves puzzling for the competing chefs; and there is hesitation about transforming a cookie.

3.title: Short and Sweetbreads
3.plot: Sweetbreads and a strong spice blend show up in the first two rounds. For dessert, the final two chefs serve dishes that are chocolaty, salty and fruity.

4.title: Fig Out
4.plot: Two fishy ingredients are used in the appetizer round. Later, entrées are made with spiny leaves and beef kidneys; and a collision in the kitchen occurs when the two finalists rush to make desserts from figs and lemon verbena.

8.title: Big Hitters
8.plot: A battle, featuring chefs from baseball stadiums, finds the competitors cooking with Italian sausage, flank steak and blueberries.

9.title: Offal Surprise
9.plot: The chefs get creative with ramen in the appetizer round; and stress over an offal surprise when making entrées. Also: the dessert basket contains four ingredients, including a New England treat.

10.title: Haricot Flair
10.plot: Four women compete to prepare tasty appetizers, using banana blossoms. Later, a notoriously stinky ingredient is featured in entrée dishes; and dessert baskets hold a colorful surprise.

11.title: Frankly Frantic
11.plot: The chefs open the appetizer basket to find vegan franks and three other meatless ingredients. In the entree round, the judges wonder if a chef's decision about what to throw into the blender will be a blunder or a sweet success.

1.title: Teen Tournament: Part One
1.plot: Part 1 of 5. Teens compete in an appetizer round that features lamb loin chops and kale chips. Later, they are given French fries and cookies to use in their entrées; and must transform a frozen treat into a new and delicious dessert.

2.title: Teen Tournament: Part Two
2.plot: Part 2 of 5. Teens compete, beginning when they prepare shrimp and jalapeños in the appetizer round. Later, they must create entrées out of frog legs; and combine an iconic New York cookie with a popular nut to make desserts.

3.title: Teen Tournament: Part Three
3.plot: Part 3 of 5. Teens compete to serve the best appetizer featuring dandelion greens. Later, they turn to the fryer when cooking Cornish hens; and try their luck with the ice cream machine when making desserts.

4.title: Teen Tournament: Part Four
4.plot: Part 4 of 5. Four teens compete for the last spot in the finale. The battle begins with the young chefs using salsa verde in their appetizer dishes. Later, entrée ingredients include couscous and buffalo.

5.title: Teen Tournament: Grand Finale
5.plot: Conclusion. Teens compete for the grand prize of $25,000 and a culinary school scholarship. Their first obstacle involves turning a sea creature into an appetizer. Later, they are given a classic kids' snack to transform into an entrée.

6.title: Food Truck Fight
6.plot: Chefs who operate food trucks and carts compete. Their first challenge is to create an appetizer, from ingredients ranging from a cheap, sweet treat to a fine-dining indulgence. Later, they find a pork delicacy and a Mexican staple in their entrée baskets.

7.title: Ultimate Champions: Pros
7.plot: Part 1 of 5. The "Ultimate Champions" tournament begins with professional chefs competing. Their first challenge is to use eels and a salty veggie in appetizer dishes. Later, their entrée ingredients include a bird and a soda.

8.title: Ultimate Champions: Amateur Champs
8.plot: Part 2 of 5. Amateur winners return to compete for the "Ultimate Champions" title, in a battle that begins with salsa and cheese blintzes as appetizer ingredients. Later, 2 chefs vie to use a certain piece of equipment in the entrée round.

9.title: Ultimate Champions: Heroes
9.plot: Part 3 of 5. Two firefighters, a police officer and an Army vet compete for a spot in the "Ultimate Champions" finale. On the menu: pineapple and nut bars as appetizer ingredients; entrées made with spring garlic and lamb chops.

10.title: Ultimate Champions: Celebrities
10.plot: Part 4 of 5. Laila Ali, Brandi Chastain, Gillian Vigman and Carnie Wilson compete for the last spot in the "Ultimate Champions" finale. For appetizers, they are forced to work with a peculiar type of flour and sweet tea.

11.title: Ultimate Champions: Grand Finale
11.plot: Conclusion. A professional chef competes against three amateurs in the "Ultimate Champions" finale. For appetizers, they are given risotto as an ingredient. Later, a huge surprise in the entrée basket receives mixed reactions.

12.title: Short Order Cooks
12.plot: Fourth- and fifth-grade students compete to create delicious dishes with the mystery ingredients provided, including cotton candy, pizza dough, a bitter green, and brownie mix.

13.title: Money Saver
13.plot: The competing chefs are given mystery basket ingredients, that cost less than $10, and are expected to transform them into winning dishes. Included: a meatless appetizer round; ham steaks as entrées; and chocolate chips for dessert.

1.title: Mummies and Gummies
1.plot: Halloween-theme baskets include a freaky gummy and a funny mummy in the appetizer round. Later, entrée dishes must highlight some awfully scary offal; and desserts are made with pretzel spiderwebs and blue cheese.

6.title: Chopped Family Thanksgiving
6.plot: Four judges become competitors in a battle with a Thanksgiving theme. Included: Maneet Chauhan, Alex Guarnaschelli, Marc Murphy, Chris Santos are given hominy and gummy turkey feet in appetizer round.

7.title: Chopped Chops
7.plot: The chefs open the first basket to find frog legs and some fine fungi. In the entree round, little beans and big pork chops cause the competitors difficulties; one of the finalists incorporates cheese into an ice cream.

8.title: Pesto Chango
8.plot: Pesto sauce and chicken are the mandatory appetizer ingredients; the chefs are forced to get creative when spirulina chips appear in the entrée baskets; and a treat from Kazakhstan helps make the dessert round interesting.

9.title: Meatball Madness
9.plot: A meatball battle forces the chefs to get creative, especially when it comes to dessert. Basket ingredients include crème brulee and boar shoulder.

10.title: The Holiday Kitchen
10.plot: A holiday battle features The Kitchen (2014)'s hosts competing for charity. First, they use seafood salad and challah bread for appetizers; and later, take meat, potatoes and yule logs and transform the ingredients into creative entrées.

11.title: Every 'Wich Way
11.plot: A sandwich battle begins with beef brisket as the featured ingredient in the appetizer round. Later, pork shoulder and pate show up in the entrée baskets; and desserts are made using Thai curry paste and chocolate-covered espresso beans.

12.title: Family Food Fight
12.plot: A mother, father, daughter and son, who run a restaurant together, compete. In the first found, flatbread and a strong citrus are the mystery ingredients. Next, the remaining family members have to debone fish and add flavor to tofu.

13.title: Hot Stuff
13.plot: Spicy ingredients are featured in the baskets, including habanero peppers in the first round; the entrée round features a hot pepper, in beef jerky form.

1.title: Viewers' Choice Ingredients
1.plot: Mystery baskets are filled with ingredients suggested by fans via social media. Among the foods the competing chefs have to work with are a frightfully difficult protein, boxed macaroni and cheese, a giant egg and some mushy fruit.

2.title: Bizarre Baskets!
2.plot: Bizarre surprises fill the baskets, when Andrew Zimmern is on hand to judge the competition. Ingredients include an offbeat ice cream flavor, unusual meat, a pink veggie, odd eggs and a peculiar Turkish treat.

3.title: Chopped, Again!
3.plot: Four losing chefs seek redemption. Among the ingredients they have to work with are skate, pomegranate molasses, boozy ice cream, a British pudding and a German tart.

4.title: Say Cheese!
4.plot: A battle with a cheese theme. Blue cheese and goats cheese in the appetizer round; French cheeses, chicken thighs and garlic scapes in the entrée basket.

5.title: Chocolate Rush!
5.plot: Every mystery basket contains chocolate. Other ingredients include pork chops, beef and graham crackers.

6.title: Reality TV Stars
6.plot: Reality stars Renee Graziano, Travis Lofland, Amy Roloff and Kathy Wakile compete for charity. Among the ingredients they cook with are biscuit dough, vegetable cream cheese and cherry pie filling.

7.title: Late Night Food Brawl
7.plot: The chefs compete to make the best late-night dishes. Among the ingredients they work with are a carb-heavy Canadian snack and an Italian sausage for the first course. Also: they must transform tiny burgers for entrées.

8.title: Double Trouble
8.plot: Eight chefs have been invited to the Chopped Kitchen to compete in pairs. In the first round, the duos learn to navigate the space together as they make appetizers that include date vinegar and chili garlic coated peas.

9.title: T.G.I.Fry-Day
9.plot: Deep-fried food must be served during every round. Ingredients include hot dogs; taro root; cookies; cube steak; an ooey, gooey cake; and salted caramel.

10.title: Amateurs Redemption
10.plot: Home cooks compete. Ingredients include a vegan roast, a small bird, a sugary breakfast item, sweet and savory candies, and a special spice blend.

11.title: Let's Do Lunch
11.plot: Breakfast, lunch and dinner make up the three rounds. The first basket includes tiny eggs and fancy coffee; midday meals are prepared using peanut butter and jelly; and while fixing supper, one chef frantically searches for a missing ingredient.

12.title: Fake Cake, Real Stakes
12.plot: The basket ingredients are in disguise in this battle, which features fake chicken wings in the first round baskets, fake cake in the second round baskets and tomato soup in the dessert baskets.

13.title: Amateurs' Brawl
13.plot: Home cooks compete to transform ingredients, including spinach vinaigrette, chicken truffle sausage and wild boar roast into prize-winning dishes; and interesting techniques are utilized, when marshmallow chocolate cookies turn up in the dessert round.

14.title: First Responders
14.plot: Police officers and paramedics compete. Included: hummus chips and ground bison as appetizer ingredients; fiery jawbreakers and rotisserie chicken in the entrée baskets; and desserts made with angel food cake.

15.title: Fabulous Baker Boys
15.plot: Bakers compete. Included: a rich fish and rice pudding come into play, when making focaccia appetizers; the entrée round feels like a trap; and an alarming candied ingredient shows up in the dessert baskets.

16.title: Judges' Face-Off
16.plot: Four judges (Amanda Freitag, Alex Guarnaschelli, Marc Murphy and Aarón Sánchez) compete to make delicious dishes using leftovers, including tuna-noodle casserole, rice left in a pan, soup and cake. Judges: Chris Santos, Maneet Chauhan and Geoffrey Zakarian.

17.title: Big Barbecue Bout
17.plot: A barbecue battle features baskets filled with a regional BBQ sauce, jumbo shrimp, pork spare ribs, bananas and coconuts.

18.title: Thrill of the Grill
18.plot: Grilling is a requirement in each round. Included: watermelon and wine coolers are appetizer ingredients; a beautiful cut of beef and tedious-to-prep beans are used to make entrées; and desserts are created with a cone of sugar and pitcher of lemonade.

19.title: Scoop's On!
19.plot: Ice cream appears in each of the baskets, which poses a challenge when the chefs prepare dishes featuring halibut and premium cuts of beef in the appetizer and entrée rounds.

1.title: All-Stars Tournament B: Part 1
1.plot: Part 1 of 5. An all-stars tournament begins with chefs Madison Cowan, Eric Greenspan, Brian Malarkey and Art Smith competing for a spot in the $75,000 finale. Basket ingredients include something slimy and a beautiful fish.

2.title: All-Stars Tournament B: Part 2
2.plot: Part 2 of 5. Anne Burrell, Hung Huynh, Mary Sue Milliken and Dale Talde compete in an All-Stars tournament. Included: a soup and a sour surprise are found in the appetizer baskets; a cheese party food must be matched with some expensive offal.

3.title: All-Stars Tournament B: Part 3
3.plot: Part 3 of 5. The All-Stars Tournament continues with Cat Cora, Antonia Lofaso, Michael Psilakis and Marcel Vigneron competing.

4.title: All-Stars Tournament B: Part 4
4.plot: Part 4 of 5. An all-stars tournament continues with Rocco DiSpirito, Jet Tila, Lee Anne Wong and Fabio Viviani competing. Included: appetizer are made using a succulent seafood and an Asian pastry; the chefs must get creative when cooking a piece of beef in the entrée round; and fish-shaped snacks and crystals that go pop are incorporated into dessert recipes.

5.title: All-Stars Tournament B: Grand Finale
5.plot: Conclusion. Four all-star chefs (Anne Burrell, Michael Psilakis, Art Smith and Jet Tila) compete to win $75,000 for their charity. Included: something purple and something fishy in the appetizer baskets; a seafood tower in the entrée round; and desserts made using a very hot pepper and a cookie cake.

6.title: Tendon Intentions
6.plot: The chefs are given beef tendon balls in the appetizer round; have fresh vermicelli noodles to work with when making entrées; and try to successfully incorporate caramelized onions in desserts.

7.title: Rock Stars
7.plot: Musicians Lita Ford, Kelly Hansen, Eddie Ojeda and Dweezil Zappa compete for charity, in a battle that finds them cooking with a bubbly drink, lamb, rock candy and lemon rolls.

8.title: Wild Ride
8.plot: The basket ingredients have a carnival theme. In the appetizer round, two deep-fried foods need to be transformed. Later, an outrageous sundae and toasted ravioli pose a challenge; and the judges find themselves faced with an unprecedented dilemma.

9.title: College Challenge
9.plot: Four college students compete. The first round features a dorm-life starchy staple and a bag of frozen veggies. Later, entrée are made using a savory microwavable snack; and sweet and salty surprises are found in the dessert baskets.

10.title: Light Makes Right
10.plot: Healthy ingredients are used by the chefs, who are faced with the challenge of creating dishes that are nutritious and moderate in calories. Included: fish appetizers; entrées with a bit of heat; and desserts made out of green smoothies and rice crackers.

11.title: Tailgate Fate
11.plot: Competing chefs prepare food for a tailgate party. For appetizers, pretzel rolls and chicken wings are on the menu. Later, they try to impress the judges with what they can do with burger patties and four fruity surprises.

12.title: Chopped Gastropub
12.plot: The competing chefs are asked to make delicious gastropub food, beginning in the appetizer round, which features smoked bacon and pickles. Later, a cocktail and classic English pub dish are transformed into entrées.

13.title: Holiday Cooking
13.plot: Cooking Channel stars Gabriele Corcos, Kelsey Nixon, Roger Mooking and Jim Stacy take on a holiday challenge, worth $10,000, for their favorite charity. Ingredients included a whole roasted goose, meat and potatoes, fruit and pie dough.

21.title: Grill Masters: Episode One
21.plot: Part 1 of 5. Big personalities and old rivalries compete for the title of Grill Master. Among the proteins they have to prepare are pork chops and sausages; a sweet ingredient shows up in the entrée round; and desserts are made with a cheese.

22.title: Grill Masters: Episode Two
22.plot: Part 2 of 5. Grill masters are given hot dogs and hamburgers to work with in the appetizer round; and run into timing issues, when preparing rack of elk in the entrée round. In the dessert round, the two remaining chefs have high hopes for what they can make, using chocolate cupcakes.

23.title: Grill Masters: Episode Three
23.plot: Part 3 of 5. Grill masters battle, including two chefs who are engaged to be married. Round 1 features a succulent seafood and an odd ice cream; the second mystery basket contains a live ingredient.

24.title: Grill Masters: Episode Four
24.plot: Part 4 of 5. Grill masters are given spare ribs, a giant whole fish and plums to work with, in the final preliminary battle before the grand finale.

25.title: Grill Masters: Grand Finale
25.plot: Conclusion. The four finalists in the "Grill Masters" tournament face off for the $50,000 grand prize. Ingredients include rattlesnake, offal, fruit, a breakfast item and a classic pie.

1.title: Teen Tournament: Part 1
1.plot: Part 1 of 5. Teens compete. Included: appetizers are made with a fuzzy ingredient; a challenging protein is paired with a processed cheese in the entrée round; and a number of problems are encountered as the two finalists combine chips and candies.

2.title: Teen Tournament: Part 2
2.plot: Part 2 of 5. Teens compete in three rounds, beginning when they transform expensive crustaceans in appetizers. Also: nerves and mishaps plague the contestants, while making lamb entrées.

3.title: Teen Tournament: Part 3
3.plot: Part 3 of 5. The teen tournament continues with the competitors trying to transform basket ingredients that include vegan chicken, butternut squash, okra, a box of assorted cookies, walnuts and plums.

4.title: Teen Tournament: Part 4
4.plot: Part 4 of 5. Teens compete. Included: the appetizer round features a spicy protein and strong pepper; the judges resist the urge to help, when thick veal chops and beautiful heirloom tomatoes are uncovered in the entrée baskets.

5.title: Viewers' Baskets
5.plot: Basket ingredients chosen by viewers include a curious canned product, weird candy, a slimy surprise, an unusual condiment and a dairy delicacy.

6.title: Teen Tournament: Grand Finale!
6.plot: Conclusion. The teen tournament comes to an end, with the final four competing for $25,000. Included: the appetizer basket contains pasta, jarred seafood, candy and a veggie; the entrée round starts off with the breaking down of a giant fish.

7.title: Teen Redeem
7.plot: Teen chefs seek redemption. Included: the temptation to make crab cakes strikes in the appetizer round; a nostalgic candy causes unhappiness when making entrées; and Italian cookies and peanut butter toast show up in the dessert baskets.

8.title: Sitcom Moms
8.plot: Four funny women, known for playing moms on sitcoms, test their kitchen skills. Their challenges include turning mushrooms and frozen TV dinners into appetizers; not overcooking one-minute steak; and getting creative with tiramisu and strawberry sauce.

9.title: Bizarre Battle
9.plot: To the surprise of the chefs, bizarre foods are found in all of the baskets. Appetizer ingredients include a strange bird part and a stinky young fruit; entrées are made with hot candies and offal; and desserts prove tricky when using something purple and something fermented.

10.title: Oktoberfest!
10.plot: Oktoberfest is celebrated with basket ingredients that include pretzels, sauerkraut, schnitzel, beer, spaetzle and chocolate sausage.

11.title: Thanksgiving Soup-Er Stars
11.plot: Chefs, who work in soup kitchens, compete in three rounds with a Thanksgiving theme.

12.title: Cooking with Bass
12.plot: Chicken hearts are a mandatory appetizer ingredient; entrées featuring sea bass and an expensive spice are prepared; and the chefs try to make delectable desserts, using brittle and zucchini.

13.title: Mac and Cheese
13.plot: Macaroni and cheese is the common theme in every round; mac and cheese dishes that include Swiss chard; a time-crunch in the dessert round leaves one of the chefs dashing to get all the components on the plate.

31.title: Chopped: Impossible, Part 1
31.plot: Part 1 of 4. The first of three preliminary battles features returning champs faced with mind-blowing baskets. Among the ingredients the chefs have to work with are whipped topping, offal, stinky cookies and a food with teeth.

32.title: Chopped: Impossible, Part 2
32.plot: Part 2 of 4. Robert Irvine joins judges Maneet Chauhan and Geoffrey Zakarian. Included: nerves are an issue for some competitors, when preparing appetizers with a strange duck and green dessert. Also: an infamous "Chopped" ingredient makes a return.

33.title: Chopped: Impossible, Part 3
33.plot: Part 3 of 4. The "Chopped: Impossible" tournament continues with chefs facing ingredients that include a swamp creature, insects, a sweet spring treat, an aged egg, whimsical sushi, leftover fruit and a frozen favorite.

34.title: Chopped: Impossible, Grand Finale
34.plot: Conclusion. The "Chopped: Impossible" tournament comes to a close. Appetizer ingredients include a giant clam and a fast-food classic; and entrees are made with something nostalgic and a sandwich of something strange.

1.title: A Chopped Halloween
1.plot: A Halloween battle begins with real blood and fake eyeballs in the first round. Later, seafood that's shaped like a coffin is used in entrées; and a ghostly drink and some chocolate creepy crawlies are found in the dessert baskets.

2.title: Chopped Catwalk
2.plot: Four chefs, who also work as fashion models, compete. Among the ingredients they have to work with are tuna, kale chips, seeds, something frozen and a crunchy food.

3.title: Food Truck Kitchen
3.plot: Chefs who operate food trucks compete. Included: Chinese and Greek cuisines collide in the appetizer round; entrée baskets contain a classic American street food and a fun-to-say Korean dish; and an unripe fruit and much loved sweet spread are used to make desserts.

4.title: Military Vets
4.plot: Veterans of the U.S. armed forces face off in challenges, in which they must create original dishes, using scalloped potatoes, pre-cooked meatloaf and a sweet and tart drink.

5.title: Chopped Desserts!
5.plot: Four pastry chefs compete in rounds featuring chocolate, candy and cake creations. Basket ingredients include Mississippi mud pie, cherries, something bubbly and something crispy, and finally, rice and avocados.

6.title: In-Laws, in Teams!
6.plot: Pairs of mothers and daughters-in-law compete. In the appetizer round, a boozy accessory and standard leftover are part of the challenge; odd eggs and mashed potatoes are turned into entrées; and the dessert baskets hold a subtropical fruit.

7.title: Battle of the Grandpas
7.plot: Grandpas compete. Mystery baskets contain a breakfast starch and classic soda fountain choice in the appetizer round; beef and peanut butter taffy bites are used to make dinner; and confusion strikes one of the contestants, when creating dessert out of a honey pie and fresh fruit.

8.title: Family Affair
8.plot: A mom, dad, son and aunt, who work in the same restaurant, compete against each other. In the first round, there's a grill pan takeover. Later, chicken breasts seem like an easy entrée ingredient; and desserts are made using dried fruit.

1.title: Knife Strife
1.plot: Blood sausages are featured in the appetizer round; the chefs attempt ambitious entrées when given a caramelized pudding and a pork product; and decadent desserts are created with a fat and a dough.

2.title: Healthy Rivalry
2.plot: Light dishes are made with nutritious ingredients. Included: time management is a problem for two chefs making fish appetizers with an unusual alternative carb. Also: a grain and a green noodle are used when preparing entrées.

3.title: Brunch Battle
3.plot: A brunch theme finds the competing chefs working with booze and eggs; and in the dessert round, a fried sweet is paired with a poached fruit.

4.title: Chinese New Year
4.plot: Chinese New Year is celebrated in the kitchen, during rounds that feature a favorite dish of Americans, a giant fish, an oversized cookie and a strawberry-flavored treat.

5.title: Tailgate Party
5.plot: Competing tailgaters are less than thrilled with the presence of a vegetarian patty in their appetizer baskets. Later, cheese and sausage are the mandatory entrée ingredients; and a sweet and salty treat needs to be transformed for the win.

6.title: Bacon Boys
6.plot: Bacon is featured in each round, beginning with an appetizer basket containing banana jam. Later, the all-male chefs are challenged to use a weird ice cream and some lovely greens in their entrée dishes.

7.title: Love Bites
7.plot: Aphrodisiacs are in all the baskets. In the appetizer round, some chefs are turned off by oysters; the judges aren't happy, when some sexy ingredients are left in the pan and don't make it to their plates; and two premade desserts could be a trap.

8.title: Ready for Redemption
8.plot: Four former runners-up return. The appetizer challenge includes a shocker of a protein and some sweet jam; sugar (cheesecake) and spice (garam masala) are in store for the chefs in the entrée round.

9.title: Cooking Caribbean
9.plot: Caribbean cuisine is prepared by the competing chefs. Included: a setback occurs while making shrimp appetizers; the basket ingredients inspire laborious entrée plates; desserts are created with sweet potatoes and rum.

10.title: Truck Stop Stars
10.plot: Chefs at truck stops compete in a battle full of comfort food. Included: meatloaf mix and fennel are the appetizer ingredients; entrees must include a purple veggie and a sweet drink; and the challenge is to transform apple pie in the dessert round.

11.title: Beg, Borrow or Eel
11.plot: The competing chefs aren't happy with a slimy surprise in the appetizer baskets. Later, the judges are eager to taste Cornish hen entrees; and are curious about a bold choice made with a nostalgic treat in the dessert round. Judges: Maneet Chauhan; Aarón Sánchez and Chris Santos.

12.title: Chopped: College
12.plot: Four college kids, with solid pedigrees in cooking, try to make the grade, beginning in the appetizer round, when they face turning chicken and tomato soup into something worthy of an "A". Later, a hot drink and frozen side dish show up in the entrée round; and desserts are created using a tropical fruit and tasty topping.

13.title: The Bold and the Baconful
13.plot: A certain fun food is wrapped in bacon in the appetizer round; pork and noodle entrees are presented to the judges; and one of the final chefs goes bold, when making dessert.

1.title: Chopped Champions: Battle 1, Best of the Best
1.plot: Part 1 of 5. The Chopped Champions tournament begins with four defending champs taking on pig ears in the appetizer round; the combo of fish and cheese, when cooking entrees; and artichokes as a mandatory ingredient, when making desserts.

2.title: Chopped Champions: Battle 2, Fighting Shape
2.plot: Part 2 of 5. Returning champions compete. Included: the appetizer basket features a deceptively simple sausage and cabbage; entrée dishes center around an organ meat; and the final two chefs face an extremely challenging dessert round.

3.title: Chopped Champions: Battle 3, Chefs in Control
3.plot: Part 3 of 5. Four returning champions compete. Included: the appetizer baskets contain a hard-to-melt candy and a difficult-to-prep veggie; a seemingly chaffy protein proves difficult to handle in the entrée round; and bison jerky must be used in desserts.

4.title: Chopped Champions: Battle 4, Kitchen Storm
4.plot: Part 4 of 5. A husband and wife are among the returning champions. Challenges include making appetizers with crab claws and vanilla frosting; and entrees with wild boar. Also: a savory mousse must be used in the dessert round.

5.title: Chopped Champions: Conclusion, $50,000 Pay Day
5.plot: Conclusion. Returning champions compete for $50,000. Appetizer ingredients include unusual clams and a decadent meat; a protein that takes up almost the entire basket is used in the entrée round; and onions pose a challenge when making desserts.

6.title: Cinco de Mayo Fiesta
6.plot: A Cinco de Mayo theme takes the chefs by surprise, especially when a green pie and a big fish fillet are revealed in the appetizer baskets. For entrees, a cheese blend and Mexican barbecue specialty are combined; and black beans and chocolate come to play in the dessert round.

7.title: Tortellini Trials
7.plot: The competing chefs have difficulty getting creative with pasta in the appetizer round. Later, the judges worry about how a chocolate-covered ingredient will be handled in the entrée round; and desserts are made with a tropical fruit and an extremely savory jarred product.

8.title: Hungry for Love
8.plot: Eight singles are paired up on blind cooking dates in this battle. Ingredients for Round 1 include scallops in the shell and a strange citrus; all six competitors choose to grind their entrée protein; and crème anglaise seems like a gift when it comes time to make desserts.

9.title: Summer Heat
9.plot: Seasonal summer foods are in the baskets, including lobsters and cocktails in Round 1. Later, entrees are made using seafood and potato chips; and a refreshing beverage and indulgent frozen treat are among the dessert ingredients.

10.title: Deadliest Baskets
10.plot: Ingredients, that are actually dangerous, are found in the baskets, beginning with poisonous seeds and rattlesnakes in Round 1. Later, a potent alcohol and shellfish put fear in the chefs; and some ugly fungus and deadly fruit keep the finalists on their toes, when making desserts. Judges: Aarón Sánchez; Marc Murphy and Marcus Samuelsson.

11.title: Chopping Block Blues
11.plot: The perfect pub Scotch egg offers a bit of a challenge to the chefs in the appetizer round; big fish and a black liquid need taxing when making entrees; and an extremely sugary kids' cereal goes into the finalists' desserts.

12.title: San Franchopco
12.plot: Four chefs from San Francisco battle. In the first round, a midnight snack poses a creative challenge. Later, a beer and a bird are familiar entrée ingredients; and premium chocolate bars and Irish coffee are found in the dessert baskets.

13.title: Leap of Faith
13.plot: A priest, a nun-in-training, a rabbi and a pastor compete. In the first round, one of the cooks shocks the judges, by admitting they have never worked with the basket ingredient of salmon -- or for that matter any fish -- before. Later, fruit and wine must be incorporated into entrée dishes; and yummy desserts represent the heritages of the finalists.

16.title: Grill Masters Napa: Part 1
